reporting-org.narrative: Ajuda de Desenvolvimento de Povo para Povo

title.narrative: Small holder farmers and marginalized groups united as one to increase financial security, food security and improve livelihoods in Sofala Province, Mozambique

description.narrative: The project envisages to enhance wealth creation among 10,000 rural poor women and men in Nhamatanda district in Sofala province. The project will improve food security, increase incomes & advocate for social equity. Small holder farmers will be organised into association; empowered and trained to increase agricultural productivity & improve post-harvest management; create jobs in processing and animal husbandry, link the producers to markets especially vulnerable groups

participating-org.narrative: Ajuda de Desenvolvimento de Povo para Povo

recipient-country.narrative: The project is implemented only in Mozambique

sector.narrative: The project supports 2000 farmers in conservation agriculture through organising them into clubs.

provider-org.narrative: Ajuda de Desenvolvimento de Povo para Povo (ADPP) used own funds and DFID will pay this in arrears
